snippet: Nevada’s attorney general and governor said Monday that they will not defend the state’s gay marriage ban when it goes before a federal appeals court.
abstract: Nevada Atty Gen Catherine Cortez Masto and Gov Brian Sandoval say they will not defend the state's gay marriage ban when it goes before a federal appeals court, saying that a court decision makes state's arguments supporting its constitutional amendment indefensible.
lead_paragraph: Nevada’s attorney general and governor said Monday that they will not defend the state’s gay marriage ban when it goes before a federal appeals court.

headline.main: Gay Marriage Ban Support Slips in Nevada

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
